question:
The J&K reorganisation bill, 2019 was passed. In this regard consider the following:
  1. The bill separates the state of J&K into 2 states.
  2. The newly formed J&K will have a legislative assembly with 83 seats.
  3. The J&K legislative assembly will be abolished.
Which of the above statements are correct?
explanation: Explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: The reorganisation bill after enactment will create 2 union territories out of the J&K state. The Ladakh UT and J&K UT will be the results. The constitution provides the power of creation of states and UT under article 3 to the centre. This does not require the state’s permission, but its opinion may be considered. The state of J&K was protected from centre’s powers by the article 370 and this is about to be abrogated. Statement 2 is incorrect: The J&K UT to be formed will have a legislative assembly. This assembly will have 107 seats. However, 24 of its seats will be vacant. This is to account for the constituencies that fall under the Pakistan occupied Kashmir/ PoK area. Also, there will be reservation of seats for SC and ST in proportion to their population. Statement 3 is correct: The bill calls for abolishing the legislative council. It is the upper house of the J&K legislature. It’s also called the J&K Vidhan Parishad. It has 36 seats and the members are not selected by direct election. It has 2 regular sessions and can introduce bills for legislation except money bills. This body will be dissolved by the reorganisation bill.
